info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Catawba, southeastern Alexander and northwestern Iredell Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Statesville, or 4 miles east of Stony Point, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Statesville, Stony Point, Claremont, Catawba, Lookout Shoals Lake, Lake Norman State Park, Lake Norman, Scotts, Oxford and Bandys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
